headline: Rachel's Cranberry Chicken Salad
description: A light cranberry chicken salad with the sweetness of dried cranberries and the crunch of pecans. This can be served in a sandwich or eaten as is.
name: Rachel's Cranberry Chicken Salad
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup sweetened dried cranberries (such as Ocean Spray® Craisins®)
1 pinch salt and black pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together chicken and mayonnaise in a bowl, stir to coat well. Stir in green onions, dried cranberries, apple, pecans, lime juice, dill weed, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for several hours or overnight (the flavor just gets better).

review.reviewBody: I substitute grapes or raisins in place of the Craisins which reduces the calories and sugar content. You can also dice a hard boiled egg.

Love it!! This is my go to Chicken salad all the time. Never have or thought to shred apples; always diced. Like the shred a lot! I add a 1/4 tsp of garlic powder. This is truly an excellent salad over lettuce or on a pretzel bun!
I added thinly sliced celery & chopped pecans. Delicious!
Very tasty just measurements need adjusted. Evidently I had large chicken breasts so ended up with enough for 8 sandwiches

This is my all time favorite chicken salad! It's so versatile. I can mix up what type of nuts, swap cherries for the cranberries... but even just as it's written, it's delicious. I've made this more times than I can count!!
It was delicious, I substituted walnuts for pecans, omitted the dill and used red onions instead of scallions, definitely will make again.

This is the best chicken salad I’ve made to date. The recipe has been printed to be used indefinitely! I added chopped celery, used less mayo, and went without the green onion. But it’s so refreshing and delicious.
I made this double recipe and everyone loved it. I added 2 stalks of celery for that extra crunch. I also crock potted the chicken in apple juice (about 1 cup) with salt and pepper. Delicious
Delicious! I can even eat this without bread!
Excellent recipe! So full of well-balanced flavor, easy to make.
Nothing special

Delicious chicken salad! I used celery instead of green onion and curry instead of dill but otherwise stayed with the original recipe. I’ve made it three times and every time it has been a hit! Served it on croissants, lettuce leaves, and whole grain bread — all excellent!

Delicious and easy! With canned chicken and my fresh chives substituted for the green onions, I had everything on hand. To me, the lime juice is the key - I used bottled as I didn’t have fresh limes. I have made this before with chicken breast cooked overnight in the slow cooker and it’s delicious that way, as well!

This is delicious! I poach chicken breast to make this pretty much every week. I have subbed celery for the apples, and almonds for the pecans, just depending on what's in the house. I don't usually use the dill weed. So good! Thank you for sharing this recipe!

Made this according to the recipe. Turned out fantastic ! I also added a celery stock. Unfortunately, being diabetic I made the second batch without the cranberries. I was still impressed. I did love the cranberries ! Excellent recipe.

Lots of changes. Used 1/4 cup mayo 1/4 cup Greek Yogurt. Added Cherries and walnuts. I cooked the chicken with olive oil rub. Added salt, pepper, garlic, and light jerk seasoning. Came out great. My wife said I should open a restaurant.

I made this recipe exactly as written for a lunch today. It turned out very tasty. I did not have time to cook chicken, I used 2 cans 13oz. chicken. I was concerned about using the lime juice and dill, but they added nice flavor to the salad.
Sub pecans for walnuts and lime for lemon because that what i had on hand. Family enjoyed it . I will make this dish again.

I love this recipe! I do omit the nuts but other than that I follow the recipe as is. I've made this for a pot lucks and everyone loves it. The best part of this recipe besides the yummy taste is that it takes little time to make it. Thank you for sharing your recipe.
I've been making this for years and it's always a HUGE hit! So very glad I've found this recipe.

I would make again. I didn't have all the ingredients so I used red onion and celery in lieu of green onions and apples and no dill but it still was delicious. My 1st time making a chicken salad and I was quite pleased with the final result.

This was delicious and a big hit at my daughter-in-law’s baby shower. We served it on Hawaiian dinner rolls spread with a light layer of pineapple cream cheese. I left out the green onions- some family members don’t like onions- but I had added a little shake of paprika to the mix. So good!
Loved this recipe! Didn't make any changes and it was delicious. Family loved it and I'll definitely make it again and again!
Instead of apples, I add chopped celery and for seasoning, curry powder makes an amazing taste!
I used canned chicken breast from Costco and I thought I was very tasty. This tastes similar to a chicken salad Panera served.

Exactly what i was looking for. Had to use red onion, as that's all i had on hand, but will use green next time. And i grated old cheddar in because i love it with apple and pecans. I doubled the recipe, but substituted 1/2 cup of sour cream, for the extra 1/2 cup of mayo. Thank you!
Excellent salad. Apple gives it a little sweetness.

Pretty easy and delicious. I probably used a little more meat to make it less of a "paste" for lack of better word and it's pretty tasty. Also used about 1/7 of a large spanish onion, minced, instead of the green onions.
This recipe is a family favorite! Anytime I have leftover chicken, this salad is going be made. Never any left. This is one of those recipes where you better get some now 'cause later is too late!
That was really good! I didn’t add the apples or pecans, because I didn’t have any. It was still very tasty and will definitely make again
Great overall. Tastes fantastic. I need a way to have more moisture without adding more mayo. I'm not the biggest mayo fan.

I’ve made this chicken salad a couple times and used a Fuji apple and walnuts since that’s what I had on hand, and omitted the dill weed since I didn’t have any. However, it still tasted delicious!! Love this recipe!!!
Kids loved it

Love this salad. It's the only chicken salad recipe I will make! Easy to change up too, but I never leave anything out. Sometimes I add pepitas or sunflower seeds. Sometimes I do pecans, sometimes walnuts. And I don't like my salads too saucy so I scale back the Mayo and often cut it half and half with plain Greek yogurt. My small children LOVE it too!!!
It was fantastic.
Great recipe and very easy.
It turned out great! I substitute green onions for red onions and used walnuts instead of pecans because that is what I had on hand.
Fantastic! I made it exactly according to the recipe. My husband loves it which is a miracle in itself!

Made Cranberry Balsamic Glazed Chicken Thighs the night before. Deboned & Shredded the leftover chicken. Finely diced 1/2 an apple instead of shredding and used walnuts insead of pecans.
Turned out better than expected. Will make again.
Absolutely delicious just the way it is!
I used Costco Shredded rotisserie chicken and it was amazing. So good, I just upped the recipe for the extra chicken I had. Great balance of flavors
kids loved this for a school lunch bag
I didn't have apples so I substituted celery and it tasted wonderful.
Wonderful! Took a reviewers suggestion and added a bit of sour cream. Mine tended to need a lot more salt to add a bit more taste. I subbed in walnuts. My 4 yr old gobbled it up!
I have made this recipe many times and it always comes out magnificent! Very easy and never leftovers! I do not add anything I make it just as written.
I made this for lunch this afternoon and it turned out better than I thought it would. So much so that my very pickey 3 year old even ate half of what I made. Definitely a five star from me

I used rotisserie chicken. I halved the green onion amount (sometimes use onion powder) and the other 1/2 I added celery. I usually don't add apples because the cranberries are sweet enough and often I have an apple dessert. This is easy to make for a brunch the night before and then I'll serve it with croissants.

I love this salad idea. Because I did not have some ingredients I made few changes: instead of apple I added green seedless grape, instead of pecans I added walnuts and because I love avocado I tried to add an avocado to it. Its came out just perfect!!!
For me, I used less mayo and ALOT of lime juice to give it a kick. I think celery, even grated carrot would do nicely in this yummy salad.
First time making it and I love it :) I used light miracle whip and I put a little more in than called for. I like that it is a sweater chicken salad.
Made it as is, many times,.....I chop up the apple, rather than shred it...delish! If I have grapes, I'll throw some in as well.
Used Vegenaise instead of real mayo. Substituted celery for the apples, and pepitas for the pecans, only because I did not have them on hand.
First time making chicken salad had leftovers from. Easter. The only thing I didn't have was the like so I used lemon. It's so delicious! Thank you!
It's a perfect recipe for summer. We usually make sandwiches with this salad.
My husband and I loved this recipe. I did not have lime juice on hand and I subbed red onion for green onion. We enjoyed our "snack dinner" after riding horses. I will make this again.
Excellent and easy. Added dates and green onions. Delicious ??
Very delish, I added shredded carrots. This is a keeper.
Excellent just the way it is!

ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!! I have tried to find a chicken salad recipe as good as our favorite restaurant and this recipe is even better!!! I served it on Skillet or griddle browned bread with Loaded Baked Potato Soup and fruit.

Fabulous! Very easy and delicious. Made for girl's Bunco night, as written with the exception of using a red delicious apple and not including the dill. Everyone loved this chicken salad. I received five requests for the recipe.

I love this recipe, and in fact, it may become my "go-to" recipe for chicken salad! You may adapt this to the things you have on hand, as I did. I doubled the recipe, used rotisserie chicken, so no need for salt and pepper; threw the whole Fuji apple in; added a bit more mayo and eyeballed the pecans. I love the addition of dill, and the lime juice was inspired. To stretch it a bit, next time I will add diced celery. Again, loved it, and thanks for submitting!

I used almonds because I didn't have any pecans on hand; i added chicken broth to make it a little wet and lightened up on the mayonnaise; and i also added a quarter of a red onion. Came out absolutely delicious!!!
Wonderful. Reminds me of a citrus chicken salad I love near my daughter's boarding school. She made it with some modifications: no pecans, less dill. I might try with the full dill next time.

My favorite chicken salad. Sometimes I add a little strawberry salad dressing to the mayo or sweetened pecans. Doesn't really change the taste, just adds a sweetness that makes it a little special and great for company or for a potluck.
Subbed celery for green onion but otherwise made as directed. Very nice, will def try again. Thanks to OP and other reviewers!
I made this for relatives stopping through town on their road trip, and everyone loved it. I will definitely keep this recipe handy.
I didn't make any changes and it was perfect.

This is so good! We used a package of the Costco grilled chicken breast strips chopped up. We didn't really measure anything but used all the the recipe called for. Served on croissants with cheddar or muenster cheese! Yum!!!!!
I have made it twice now. When I baked the chicken breast I put rosemary on them and OMG it was soooo good.
I would've taken a picture and posted it but we ate all of it before I could!
Made exactly as written, and it was the best chicken salad I ever had! This is my go to recipe.

yum! I used leftover rotisserie chicken from Costco and nixed the apple ,dill and lemon juice. I used pistachios instead of Pecans. I am sure the Pecans would be delish just didn't have any at hand. Also used plain greek yogurt instead of mayo.Wrapped in a whole wheat tortilla and added some spinach.. Wonderful clean lunch!

Very good. After making the salad, I cooked and added a box of macaroni noodles and a bit of left over rice to make it more filling. I was hoping for left overs but there was none. (I guess that's ok :/ )

This chicken salad is terrific! I have been looking for a recipe to try and make it like my local hometown coffee café and this is it. My only changes were using a chopped red apple instead of green, and I added a few drops of liquid stevia to the mayo mixture to give it a hint of sweetness. This will definitely be my go-to recipe from now on.

I have had a thing for the chicken salad at Costco for a few years now. Saw this recipe and tried it out today and all I can say is WOW! Theirs pales in comparison, and it's quite a bit less expensive to make. This will be a regular menu item for us. It's perfect for a snack and is great in wraps. Two thumbs up!!

Wonderful salad! I didn't have a green Apple or pecans so I used a tart red apple and walnuts. I wasn't sure about using dill, but am glad I did--the comments were right as the dill added an extra interesting flavor. I will try it with green apples and pecans next time. This Recipe is a keeper!
I didn't use pecans because they are so expensive. I added celery for crunch. Loved loved this recipe. Will make it again!
This was delicious! I have made it often and is a favorite! Great for luncheons and hot summer evenings and well, anytime! I have used red onion as a substitute and it is great also.
I serve it on a bed of lettuce

I made this tonight for the second time. Again, it didn't wow me. My husband liked it, but he'll eat anything so that doesn't say much. I feel there isn't enough flavor from the apple and would suggest chopping one into small chunks, and not grating it. I again couldn't detect the dill amongst the other flavors. I added celery this time and left the green onion in as well, and there was still not enough other items besides chicken. I'd suggest upping the amount of green onions at least, if not adding in another item for additional flavor. Not a bad recipe, but definitely not one I have a desire to make again.

Loved it! I didn't shred the apple- just chopped it finely because I was in an ill-equipped kitchen. I think this helped with adding crunch and didn't make it watery as some reviewers have noted. This will be my new go-to chicken salad recipe!

I used 1/2 of a rotisserie chicken, shredded. I didn't have an apple so I cut up some seedless grapes and I used almonds instead of pecans. Delicious on croissants with a slice of tomato and shredded lettuce. It's a keeper!

I didn't have an apple or the cranberries the first time I made this. . . I added chopped green pepper. Also added a bit of chicken granules and used more pecans. The second time I didn't have a green pepper but did have an apple and cranberries:) Great both ways. I probably used less mayo . . just enough to mix. I realized I prefer chicken shredded better than cubed, and chopped apple better than grated - just me turning picky in my old age. Thank you Rachel, I'll make this again!
I made this exactly as written except for the pecans (nut allergy). My husband loved it! He asked what deli I picked it up from so we could get more :-)

i wanted to try something different and had leftover grilled chicken so i chose this.. i left out the apple and subbed dried cherries for the dried cranberries, which i soaked in hot water and then chopped up.. i subbed almonds for the pecans.. i felt like something was missing so followed the lead of others and added some curry powder.. that was exactly what it needed.. i don't know if the dill would be necessary at this point though.. either way, ty for something new to me

Amazing! Small tweaks I made....Used rotisserie chicken, finely chopped red apples instead of green, almonds instead of pecans, used lemon juice and touch of apple cider vinegar to give it a kick! Did not use Dill. Husband absolutely loved it!!! Thx!!! ;-)
This is possibly the best chicken salad I have ever had! I double the recipe because I love it so much.

I've made this recipe dozens of times and don't think I've ever made it exactly the same way twice. It's perfect just as written, or throw in whatever you happen to have on hand. Thanks so much for sharing!
So good!! Made with a little less mayo than stated. My fave chicken salad to eat over a bed of greens or toast.
Very nice. The cranberries give it the boost it needs to go from ok to tasty.
Great recipe. Very tasty. I will definitely make this again!
I loved this recipe but I don't think it needs black pepper or dill weed
Fabulous recipe! Followed recipe except I used chicken tenderloins I cooked on my George Foreman, diced the apple and omitted the dill (not a fan of dill). So good!

This recipe was simple and delicious!!!! I used green onions and celery I also used a gala red apple instead of green and chopped it instead of shredding. I used mayo and sour cream and seasoned it with curry. My two kids absolutely loved it!!!! Thanks for sharing this awesome easy recipe!'nnn
I used lingon berries and some chipotle mustard. It was fantastic

Delicious! I didn't change any of the ingredients. I shredded the chicken because that's how we prefer it, and I diced the apple because it wouldn't shred. I served it on slider buns from the bakery. Definitely a keeper!
This is super yummy and a great way to use left over chicken. My husband loves it!

"Rachel's Cranberry Chicken Salad" is quite delicious. Next time I make it I will cut my apple-juice-sweetened cranberries by half as they were a bit sweet for my palate, and also use fresh dill. Thank you Rachel for sharing your recipe.
Very good. I made it for a church luncheon and had many compliments. No leftovers!
